[GRAMMAR]: "One July morning, over a hundred years ago there stood..." (awkward phrasing, consider rephrasing for clarity)
[LEXICON]: "in a forlorn room of a log house" (word choice could be more vivid or specific)
[SYNTAX]: "It was quite plain, her father was to go also, out into that somewhere of silence and absence..." (confusing syntax, unclear meaning)

[LOGIC]: Transition between Debby's emotional state and her actions could be smoother
[STRUCTURE]: Some paragraphs feel overly long, potentially disrupting flow
[CLARITY]: The shift from past memories to present struggles lacks clear transition

[SYNTAX]: Awkward phrasing in "the subject had ceased to interest her" (could be rephrased for smoother flow)
[LEXICON]: Overly formal language in dialogue may feel slightly anachronistic or less natural for some readers (e.g., "Dost hear?", "Wilt thou obey?")

[TRANSITION]: Abrupt shift from Debby's thoughts about her father to hating the King without clear connection
[CLARITY]: Minor ambiguity in "Bits of strange talk... came to her now" (could clarify what "those long hours" specifically refer to for better clarity)
